meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessively stable or secure.
meanings.sent1: The overstability of the old bridge made it safe for everyone to cross.
meanings.sent2: The overstability of the heavy safe ensured that no one could easily steal its contents.
meanings.sent3: The overstability of the sleepy cat made it impossible for anyone to wake it up.
meanings.sent4: The overstability of the mountain gave the climbers a sense of security as they ascended.
meanings.sent5: The overstability of the giant oak tree made it a favorite spot for picnics and gatherings.

meanings.definition: The tendency of an object or system to return to its original position after being disturbed.
meanings.sent1: After the earthquake, the overstability of the pendulum clock allowed it to keep accurate time.
meanings.sent2: The overstability of the spinning top made it fascinating to watch as it always returned to its starting point.
meanings.sent3: The overstability of the bouncing ball seemed to defy the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions had an overstability that surprised even her closest friends.
meanings.sent5: The overstability of the weather vane always pointed north, no matter how strong the wind blew.
